00020 // S75.h : main header file for the S75 Communications Library
00021 //
00022 // -------------------------------------------------------------
00023 //
00024 // Defines the following ...
00025 //--------------------------
00026 //
00027 // Constants:
00028 //-----------
00029 //
00030 //      S75_OK                  ++ most functions in this library return this constant on success.
00031 //      S75_FAILED              ++ most functions in this library return this constant on Failure.
00032 //      SIZE_PID_LIST   ++ This is the size of the PID List structure. Devices may support less than this value.
00033 //      MAX_DEVICES             ++ This is the maximum number of devices that can be contained in a device List
00034 //
00035 // Types:
00036 //-------
00037 //
00038 //      S75_Handle                      ++ This is a handle used to manipulate the device.
00039 //      VITERBI_RATES           ++ Enumerator for the different viterbi rates
00040 //      NOVRA_DEVICES           ++ Enumerator for the different devices that can be identified by this Liberary
00041 //      Novra_DeviceEntry       ++ A Structure that holds all the relevant information about the device.
00042 //      Novra_DeviceList        ++ A structure that has a list of the devices that were discovered
00043 //
00044 //      S75D_NetSetting         ++ The network setting structure for version 2.x devices.
00045 //      S75D_RFSetting          ++ The RF settings Structure for the version 2.x devices (can also be used for version 3.x)
00046 //      S75D_PIDList            ++ This structure is used to configure PIDs and as a part of the status
00047 //      S75D_Status                 ++ This is the status structure for version 2.x devices only.
00048 //
00049 //      S75D_Status_V3          ++ This is the status structure for version 3.x devices only.
00050 //      S75D_NetSetting_V3      ++ The network setting structure for version 3.x devices.
00051 //      S75D_RFSetting_V3       ++ A Rename of the RFsetting structure for consistincy  - prefered for version 3.x
00052 //      S75D_PIDList_V3         ++ A Rename of the PIDList structure for consistincy    - prefered for version 3.x
00053 //
00054 //      PesMaker_Status         ++ This is the status structure for version 5.x devices only. they forward PES packets an Ts packets 
00055 //      PesMaker_NetSetting     ++ The network setting structure for version 5.x devices only. they forward PES packets an Ts packets
00056 //      PesMaker_RFSetting      ++ A Rename of the RFsetting structure for consistincy  - prefered for 5.x devices only. thy forward PES packets an Ts packets 
00057 //      PesMaker_PIDList        ++ This structure is used to configure PIDs for version 5.x devices only. thye forward PES packets an Ts packets 
00058 //
00059 //      A75_Status                      ++ Status structure for A75
00060 //      A75_NetSetting          ++ Rename for A75 Network Settings.
00061 //      A75_RFSetting           ++ Structure that defines the RF Settings for A75
00062 //      A75_PIDList                     ++ A rename for convienience..
00063 //      A75_Handle                      ++ A Handle to A75 Devices.
00064 //
00065 //  S75_Status_JLEO       ++ This is the status structure for JLEO devices only.
00066 //  S75_NetSetting_JLEO   ++ The network setting structure for JLEO devices.
00067 //  S75_RFSetting_JLEO    ++ A Rename of the RFsetting structure for consistincy  - prefered for JLEO version
00068 //  S75_PIDList_JLEO      ++ A Rename of the PIDList structure for consistincy    - prefered for JLEO version 
00069 //  S75_TrapSetting_JLEO  ++ The trap setting structure for JLEO devices
00070 //
00071 //
00072 // Error Codes:
00073 //-------------
00074 //
00075 //      The Error Codes used by the library, Some select functions will return the error codes to the caller
00076 //      to assist in trouble shooting and extended user diagonistic messages.
00077 //
00078 // Functions
00079 //----------
00080 //
00081 //      discoverDevices         ++ Auto Discovery function
00082 //      OpenDevice              ++ Returns a Handle to a device
00083 //      configureNetwork        ++ Configure the network settings
00084 //      configureRF             ++ Configure the RF Settings
00085 //      setPIDList              ++ Configure the PID List
00086 //      getPIDList              ++ Retrieve the PID List
00087 //      getStatus               ++ Retrieves Status of the Device
00088 //      resetS75                ++ Reset teh Device
00089 //      resetCAM                ++ Reset the CAM on the device
00090 //      setCAMWatchdogTimeout           ++ Set the CAM watchdog timeout on the device
00091 //      getCAMWatchdogTimeout           ++ Get the CAM watchdog timeout from the device
00092 //      GetDeviceType           ++ Returns teh Device Type (a NovraDevice Type)
00093 //      ForceDevice             ++ Reset Network Settings to default -- Should be avoided, use only if the device isn't reachable --
00094 //      GetAvaiablePort         ++ Returns an available Status Port on your system. All status ports should be obtained this way
00095 //      SetDVBMACAddress        ++ Configure the DVB MAC Address for version 3.x devices.
00096 //      closeS75
00097 //  calcSignalStrengthPercentage
00098 //
00099 //  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00100 //
00101 //  These functions are provided for older code, It is strongly recommended that they NOT be used.
00102 //
00103 //      b_openS75               (uses byte arrays for IP and MAC)
00104 //      s_openS75               (uses strings for IP and MAC)
00105 //      b_forceS75              (uses byte arrays for IP and MAC)
00106 //      s_forceS75              (uses strings for IP and MAC)
00107 //
00108 //  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00109 //
00110 //JSAT Functions
00111 //--------------
00112 
00113 //      discoveRemoteDevice     ++ Function to get a handle for a remote device by IP address
00114 //      openRemoteDevice        ++ Returns a Handle to a remote device
00115 //      changePassword          ++ Changes the password on a device
00116 //      configureTraps          ++ Configure the Trap Settings
00117 //      pollStatus              ++ Retrieves Status of a Device by request
00118 //      broadcastPollStatus     ++ Retrieves Status of Device by request when MAC is known but not IP
00119 //      forceRemoteDevice       ++ Reset Network Settings to default -- Should be avoided, use only if the device isn't reachable --
00120 //      specifyPassword         ++ Specifies the password to send to the device when configuring
00121 //
00122 //
00123 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00124

00126 ******************************************************
00127 ******************************************************
00128 *** You will need a header file to define the TYPES **
00129 *** Windows.h , or Linux-windowstypes.h, Usually    **
00130 *** The application will include Either.            **
00131 ******************************************************
00132 *****************************************************/

00888         WORD                            DataSyncLoss;                                   
00889         WORD                            DVBAccepted;                                    
00890         unsigned long           TotalDVBPacketsAccepted[2];             
00891         unsigned long           TotalDVBPacketsRXInError[2];    
00892         unsigned long           TotalEthernetPacketsOut[2];             
00893         unsigned long           TotalUncorrectableTSPackets[2]; 
00894         WORD                            BroadcastStatusPort;                    
00895         WORD                            LocalOscFrequency;                              
00896                 
00897 } S75_Status_JLEO;

01304 // Some of the Error Definitions Overlap. This is for debugging Purpose.
01305 // At one point when the Distribution is stable these errors codes will be reduced to minimum set.
01306 
01313 #ifndef __ERRORS__

01315 #define __ERRORS__

01318 //      ==========                      ==========      ==================================

01540 // Static Library Function Declarations for Windows
01541 //**************************************************
01542 
01549 extern "C"
01550 int __stdcall discoverDevices( Novra_DeviceList *devices );
01551 
01553 
01554 // input   : none
01555 // output  : devices
01556 // returns : 0 = failure
01557 //           1 = success
01558 //
01559 // The 10 auto detect status ports are listed below ...
01560 //
01561 // 0x1974, 0x2075, 0x2175, 0x2275, 0x2375,
01562 // 0x2475, 0x3475, 0x4475, 0x4575, 0x4675
01563 //
01564 
01565 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01566 
01567 extern "C"
01568 S75_Handle __stdcall openDevice( Novra_DeviceEntry * pDev, const int  timeout, int& ErrorCode);
01569 
01571 
01572 // This function retrieves a handle to the device pointed to by pDev.
01573 
01574 // input   : Device Entry as returned by the Discover Devices, timeout (in ms)
01575 // output  : ErrorCode.
01576 // returns : valid handle or NULL pointer
01577 
01578 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01579 
01580 extern "C"
01581 S75_Handle __stdcall forceDevice( const Novra_DeviceEntry * pDev,WORD   Port, const int timeout, int& ErrorCode);
01582 
01584 
01585 // input   : Device pointer, statusPort, timeout (in ms)
01586 // output  : ErrorCode
01587 // returns : valid handle or NULL pointer
01588 // The function resets the network configuration of the prescribed device (pDev), and 
01589 // forces it to send status on the given Port (Port).
01590 
01591 //================== Start of deprecated section ===============================
01592 //
01593 // The next 4 functions allow the user to communicate with a device using MAC address and IP Address..
01594 // They are no longer supported and not recommended..they will work for version 2.1
01595 // and won't work for any other version of DSP code.
01596 
01597 extern "C"
01598 S75_Handle __stdcall b_openS75( const BYTE  S75IPAddress[4],
01599                                 const BYTE  S75MACAddress[6],
01600                                 const int   *statusPort,
01601                                 const int   *timeout          );
01602 
01604 
01605 // input   : S75IPAddress, S75MACAddress, statusPort, timeout (in ms)
01606 // output  : none
01607 // returns : valid handle or NULL pointer
01608 
01609 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01610 
01611 extern "C"
01612 S75_Handle __stdcall s_openS75( const char  *S75IPAddress,
01613                                 const char  *S75MACAddress,
01614                                 const int   *statusPort,
01615                                 const int   *timeout        );
01616 
01618 
01619 // input   : S75IPAddress, S75MACAddress, statusPort, timeout (in ms)
01620 // output  : none
01621 // returns : valid handle or NULL pointer
01622 
01623 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01624 
01625 extern "C"
01626 S75_Handle __stdcall b_forceS75( const BYTE  S75MACAddress[6],
01627                                  const BYTE  S75IPAddress[4],
01628                                  const int   *statusPort,
01629                                  const int   *timeout          );
01630 
01632 
01633 // input   : S75IPAddress, S75MACAddress, statusPort, timeout (in ms)
01634 // output  : none
01635 // returns : valid handle or NULL pointer
01636 
01637 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01638 
01639 extern "C"
01640 S75_Handle __stdcall s_forceS75( const char  *S75MACAddress,
01641                                  const char  *S75IPAddress,
01642                                  const int   *statusPort,
01643                                  const int   *timeout        );
01644 
01646 
01647 // input   : S75IPAddress, S75MACAddress, statusPort, timeout (in ms)
01648 // output  : none
01649 // returns : valid handle or NULL pointer
01650 
01651 //================== End of deprecated section ================================
01652 
01661 extern "C"
01662 int __stdcall configureNetwork( S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE* networkSettings );
01663 
01665 
01666 // The function will attempt to configure and verify the Device S75Unit, using the
01667 // Settings in the structure Network Settings.
01668 // The function will try all the possible interfaces on the machine untill a configuration is
01669 // successful.
01670 //  Care must be taken that the network setting structure is the appropriate type for the device.
01671 // input   : S75Unit, networkSettings
01672 // output  : none
01673 // returns : S75_OK or ERROR (see above)
01674 
01675 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01676 
01677 extern "C"
01678 int __stdcall configureRF( S75_Handle  S75Unit, BYTE* RFSettings );
01679 
01681 
01682 // The function will attempt to configure and verify the Device S75Unit, using the
01683 // Settings in the structure RFSettings.
01684 //  Care must be taken that the RF setting structure is the appropriate type for the device.
01685 // the device IP should be reachable by the machine
01686 
01687 // input   : S75Unit, RFSettings
01688 // output  : none
01689 // returns : S75_OK or ERROR (see above)
01690 
01691 
01692 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01693 
01694 extern "C"
01695 int __stdcall setPIDList( S75_Handle S75Unit, BYTE*  PIDs );
01696 
01698 
01699 // This function will configure the PID List on the device using the list of PIDs in
01700 // the structure S75D_PIDList
01701 
01702 // input   : S75Unit, PIDs
01703 // output  : none
01704 // returns : S75_OK or ERROR (see above)
01705 
01706 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01707
